channels.summary: Channel focused on academic OSINT, sharing articles on the limits of open-source reporting in conflicts, risks from AI-generated survey responses, new data resources for pharmaceutical research, and university-based OSINT labs and programmes, alongside discussion of media ethics and academic freedom.

highlights.title: Reuters Institute article on the power and limits of open-source reporting in the Israel–Gaza war
highlights.details: Shared as recommended reading for OSINT educators, this piece examines both the strengths and constraints of open-source methods in covering the Israel–Hamas/Israel–Gaza war, useful for classroom discussion of verification, bias, and evidentiary limits.

highlights.title: 404 Media article on an AI agent that evades online survey safeguards
highlights.details: Covers a study where an AI agent completed online scientific surveys and evaded bot-detection 99.8% of the time, raising concerns that AI-generated responses can poison social science survey datasets and wider knowledge production.

highlights.title: ProPublica data release on generic drug quality (RX Inspector)
highlights.details: Article describes a major dataset on generic drug manufacturing and quality that academic researchers say will significantly lower barriers to studying supply chains and safety, by bypassing time‑consuming data access hurdles.

highlights.title: Utrecht University Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab
highlights.details: Shared as an example of an academic OSINT lab, this programme focuses on open-source investigations in support of global justice and accountability work, potentially relevant for students and researchers seeking collaborations.

highlights.title: Queen’s University Belfast GLAN-related programme
highlights.details: Link to a Queen’s Belfast School of Law programme connected to the Global Legal Action Network (GLAN), highlighting another academic initiative using legal and investigative approaches that can intersect with OSINT and accountability work.

highlights.title: Stage Talks with Bellingcat – audio RSS feed
highlights.details: Members are reminded that recordings of Bellingcat’s Stage Talks, useful as teaching material on various OSINT topics, are available via an RSS feed compatible with most podcast apps.

highlights.title: Media-ethics readings on ‘death voyeurism’ in news imagery
highlights.details: Two articles (NYT opinion and a Guardian piece on World Press Photo) are shared to prompt reflection on the ethics of publishing ‘moment of death’ images and the impact of such imagery on audiences and photographers.

highlights.title: Terry Tao’s statement on reported suspension of his research under Trump’s UCLA crackdown
highlights.details: A user queries rumours about Fields Medalist Terence Tao’s research being suspended and then shares Tao’s own Mathstodon post as a primary source update, illustrating how to verify academic-freedom claims via direct statements.

mentions: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab

channels.summary: Staff share server-wide updates: new Bellingcat investigations on U.S. federal enforcement and immigration raids, recurring OSINT challenges, multiple Stage Talk recordings, and calls for community investigations, plus some moderation-related notices.

highlights.title: Bellingcat and Evident Media investigation of federal enforcement in Washington, DC
highlights.details: Announcement of an investigation documenting 42 verified federal agent encounters in DC in under a month of federal control, highlighting patterns like traffic stops turning into detentions and coordination with DC police.

highlights.title: Stage Talk: Identifying Explosive Ordnance
highlights.details: Recording of a Stage Talk with an expert on identifying explosive ordnance, covering EO types and use in current conflicts; the edited version removes initial technical issues and serves as a training resource.

highlights.title: Stage Talk: Open Source Munitions Portal
highlights.details: Announcement and recording link for a Stage Talk focused on the Open Source Munitions Portal, explaining how to use its datasets and imagery for munitions identification and conflict monitoring.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Open Source Challenge platform
highlights.details: Members are directed to challenge.bellingcat.com for regularly updated OSINT puzzles; a Work Out Loud session gathered feedback on puzzle design and encouraged sharing methodologies in a dedicated channel.

highlights.title: Investigation of less-lethal weapon use by a federal agent
highlights.details: CharM highlights a story where Bellingcat and Evident Media reconstructed a federal agent’s movements with a less-lethal weapon during protests, demonstrating detailed movement-tracking via open sources.

highlights.title: YouTube investigation on decades-old murder using open-source methods
highlights.details: Video by Bellingcat researcher Peter Barth shows how OSINT can illuminate a decades-old murder involving organised crime, gamblers, and pigeons, serving as a case study in long‑tail cold‑case work.

highlights.title: Investigation into grain imports from a sanctioned Crimean port to Saudi Arabia
highlights.details: Bellingcat, in partnership with Lloyd’s List, traced a Russian shadow-fleet vessel exporting grain from an occupied, sanctioned Crimean port to Saudi Arabia, showcasing sanctions‑evasion tracking via maritime OSINT.

highlights.title: Stage Talk with Jasper Hewitt (DoubleThink Lab) on Foreign Information Manipulation and Interference
highlights.details: Announcement of a Stage Talk featuring DoubleThink Lab’s Jasper Hewitt on monitoring inauthentic accounts, deep‑dive FIMI investigations, and journalist training, relevant for disinformation researchers.

highlights.title: Stage Talk with Peter Barth on open-source murder mystery investigations
highlights.details: Promotion of a Stage Talk where Peter Barth explains using open-source research to investigate historic murders, with timing info and a link to podcast distribution.

highlights.title: Call for wildlife and environment investigations using OSINT
highlights.details: Bellingcat invites proposals for wildlife and environmental investigations that rely on open-source methods, emphasising that non‑journalists can participate if work meets rigorous fact‑checking standards.

highlights.title: Bellingcat and Evident Media investigation into ICE raids and use of force in Illinois
highlights.details: Announcement of an investigation assessing ICE raids in Illinois and the use of force during immigration enforcement, with a link to the published piece.

channels.summary: Light activity with members flagging potential OSINT tasks in the Asia-Pacific region, including suspected airship/balloon facilities in remote parts of China and an island-comparison exercise off Myanmar.

highlights.title: Potential airship/balloon infrastructure in remote areas of China
highlights.details: A member mentions examining a hangar and mooring pole associated with airship/balloon sites in sparsely populated parts of China, suggesting a lead for further satellite-image analysis.

highlights.title: Island geolocation comparison task off the coast of Myanmar
highlights.details: A user shares a link to an earlier Discord message proposing a challenge to compare two islands off Myanmar’s coast, suitable as a practice exercise for coastal geolocation techniques.

channels.summary: Ongoing monitoring of art-related crime and legal resources, including museum thefts, art-linked money laundering cases, and new archival tools for historical claims, with some discussion of access to expensive specialist literature.

highlights.title: Theft of approximately 300 silver objects from Zilvermuseum Doesburg
highlights.details: Article documents a large-scale theft at a Dutch silver museum, framed as ‘theft-for-commodification’, and discusses implications for museum security and the illicit antiquities market.

highlights.title: Harvard Law School Library’s fully searchable Nuremberg Trials collection
highlights.details: Announcement that Harvard Law School Library has released a complete, fully searchable digitized collection of evidentiary documents and trial transcripts from all 13 Nuremberg Trials, valuable for WWII-era restitution and provenance research.

highlights.title: BBC report on recent art-crime case
highlights.details: A BBC article is shared in the context of art crime; while the exact headline isn’t quoted, it likely covers a current theft or recovery relevant to tracking illicit art movements.

highlights.title: Bosnian-Dutch suspect extradited to the Netherlands for cocaine trafficking and art-linked money laundering
highlights.details: Art Crime blogpost details the extradition of a Bosnian‑Dutch suspect from the UAE to the Netherlands on charges including cocaine trafficking and money laundering via the art market, illustrating how artworks can be used to move illicit funds.

highlights.title: Artnet analysis of Jeffrey Epstein and Leon Black’s art-linked tax strategies
highlights.details: Article explores how Epstein and Leon Black used art deals, loans, and shell companies to manage gains/losses under U.S. Internal Revenue Code Section 1031, highlighting mechanisms of tax arbitrage and money movement in the high-end art market.

mentions: ARCA (Association for Research into Crimes against Art)

channels.summary: Regional channel used to share major political and criminal-justice developments, including Chinese historical-political coverage and cross-border financial crime tied to human trafficking operations.

highlights.title: NYT coverage of a Chinese general linked to Tiananmen Square
highlights.details: A New York Times article is shared on a Chinese general associated with the Tiananmen Square crackdown, providing context for contemporary Chinese politics and security elites.

highlights.title: Deportation of Cambodian tycoon Chen Zhi (Prince Group) to China
highlights.details: Article reports that Chen Zhi, founder of the Prince Holding Group, was deported to China amid allegations of fraud and money laundering tied to pig‑butchering scams and forced-labour compounds, underscoring the nexus of regional organised crime and corporate structures.

channels.summary: Channel discusses aviation OSINT and safety issues, including tools for monitoring air traffic communications, investigations into SpaceX launch risks, accident-report updates, and interpretation of rare WC-135 ‘nuke sniffer’ deployments.

highlights.title: Tweetdeck-style interface for LiveATC feeds
highlights.details: An article by Ian Servin shows how to build a Tweetdeck-style dashboard for LiveATC audio streams, useful for OSINT practitioners who monitor multiple air traffic control channels concurrently.

highlights.title: BlueSky account tracking ICE aircraft via OSINT
highlights.details: A BlueSky account (@jjindc) is recommended for those interested in tracking U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement aircraft using flight-tracking and other open sources.

highlights.title: ProPublica investigation into SpaceX launches and aviation safety
highlights.details: Article examines how SpaceX launches, FAA oversight, and exploding rockets may endanger airlines operating near Florida and the Caribbean, raising questions about risk management and regulatory capture.

highlights.title: NTSB preliminary report on UPS Flight 2976 crash in Kentucky
highlights.details: Members share the official NTSB preliminary report page for the UPS 2976 crash (case DCA26MA024), enabling analysis of causal factors and how to incorporate official data into OSINT accident reconstructions.

highlights.title: Telegraph coverage of WC-135 ‘nuke sniffer’ deployment to the UK
highlights.details: Article is shared as an example of media coverage that appears whenever the rare WC‑135 is spotted; discussion notes a prior brief deployment to England with two sorties over the Baltic and debates whether such flights are routine or exceptional.

channels.summary: Short but substantive discussion about correct terminology for so-called ‘less lethal’ weapons used in protest policing, emphasising that these munitions can still be fatal.

highlights.title: Shift from ‘less-than-lethal’ to ‘less-lethal’ terminology in academic literature
highlights.details: Members note that scholars of protest policing argue ‘less than lethal’ misleadingly implies incapacity to kill, whereas ‘less-lethal’ better reflects that rubber bullets and similar munitions can and do cause deaths; terminology changed after multiple fatalities.

channels.summary: Channel shares mapping resources and reporting on military infrastructure and regional tensions, including Oxus Society datasets, DFRLab narratives about ‘biolabs’ in Armenia, and articles on Russian troop movements and peace-agreement terminology.

highlights.title: Oxus Society Tajikistan military-units visualization
highlights.details: Link to an Oxus Society interactive visualization of Tajikistan’s military units, highlighted as a resource for those researching Central Asian security forces.

highlights.title: DFRLab report on ‘biolabs’ disinformation narrative in Armenia
highlights.details: A member discusses a DFRLab report on how the ‘biolabs’ narrative used in Ukraine has been exported to Armenia, including accusations involving CDC and USAID and targeting scientific conferences, illustrating cross-theatre disinformation patterns.

highlights.title: Clarification of ‘initialed’ versus ‘signed’ peace deal in Caucasus context
highlights.details: Shared tweet clarifies that a referenced peace agreement was only ‘initialed’ (agreement on language) rather than fully signed and ratified, underscoring the importance of precise legal terminology in ceasefire reporting.

highlights.title: Euromaidan Press report on Russian troop buildup in Armenia
highlights.details: Article notes accelerated Russian troop deployments to Armenia amid rising tensions with Azerbaijan, relevant for tracking regional military dynamics and Russian basing strategy.

highlights.title: NK Observer material on the region
highlights.details: A tweet from @nkobserver is shared as a reference for ongoing monitoring of developments in the region, likely related to Nagorno-Karabakh or broader Caucasus security topics.

mentions: Oxus Society for Central Asian Affairs
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

channels.summary: Channel remains a repository for completed Ukraine geolocation tasks, with members confirming interest in further work and one detailed geolocation of damage in Kherson oblast.

highlights.title: Geolocation of residential damage in Kozats’ke & Vesele, Kherson
highlights.details: A contributor geolocates imagery from a Suspilne Kherson Telegram post (ID 2547) to specific coordinates in Kozats’ke and Vesele, Kherson oblast, providing precise latitude/longitude and a Google Maps reference.

channels.summary: Meta channel used to highlight Bellingcat outputs and infrastructure: new Stage Talk podcast episodes, the Bellingcat Toolkit, annual performance reports, an awards recognition, and security advisories about phishing attempts.

highlights.title: Stage Talk with Arthur Brand on tracking a lost Brueghel
highlights.details: Podcast episode featuring art detective Arthur Brand, explaining investigative techniques used to locate a missing Brueghel painting; recommended for those interested in art-crime OSINT.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Toolkit (one-year anniversary)
highlights.details: The revamped Bellingcat Toolkit is highlighted as a one-stop GitBook of OSINT tools with use cases, guidance, and volunteer-written reviews, aimed at helping researchers choose and apply tools effectively.

highlights.title: Bellingcat WhatsApp updates channel
highlights.details: Announcement that Bellingcat now provides updates via a WhatsApp channel, useful for members who prefer news in messaging apps or want to avoid other social media platforms.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Annual Report 2024
highlights.details: Link to the 2024 annual report summarising investigations, impact, and organisational lessons learned, giving insight into Bellingcat’s strategic direction and output.

highlights.title: Stage Talk: Mapping Central Asia’s armed forces (with Oxus Society’s Michael Hilliard)
highlights.details: Podcast episode discusses what ‘military power’ means and how logistics and mapping of Central Asian armed forces shape it, featuring Oxus Society’s Michael Hilliard and another community member.

highlights.title: Stage Talk on far-right fashion
highlights.details: Episode analysing far-right fashion as a signalling mechanism and how visual culture can be monitored via OSINT to track extremist networks.

highlights.title: Stage Talk on suspicious maritime activity (‘those sketchy boats’)
highlights.details: Podcast recording that focuses on suspicious vessels and maritime behaviour, showing how ship-tracking data and other open sources can expose illicit maritime operations.

highlights.title: Stage Talk on US immigration raids
highlights.details: Episode replays a Stage Talk on US immigration raids, relevant for understanding how to document and analyse law-enforcement operations with open sources.

highlights.title: First Stage Talk of the year – new episode link
highlights.details: A link is shared to the first Stage Talk episode of the year, continuing the series’ role as a central educational resource for the community.

highlights.title: Award recognition for Bellingcat’s ‘Open Source Extremist Identifications’ work
highlights.details: Members congratulate colleagues whose work on identifying extremists via open-source methods received recognition at the Online Journalism Awards, with a link to the awards entry.

highlights.title: Phishing warning about fake ‘Bellingcat staff’ emails
highlights.details: Moderation team asks users to forward suspicious emails claiming to be from Bellingcat staff to contact@bellingcat.com and links to a BlueSky post, signalling ongoing phishing attempts targeting the community.

channels.summary: Channel features a significant new finding on a coordinated bot network across several Latin American countries, plus follow-up discussion about whether a specific alleged incident and related letters are themselves disinformation.

highlights.title: Discovery of a LATAM-wide bot network identified via Go/Golang error signature
highlights.details: A researcher reports mapping 70+ accounts across at least five Latin American countries that share a distinctive Go formatting error string ("%!(EXTRA string=...)") and post in tightly synchronized windows, amplifying contradictory political content and illustrating a technically fingerprinted coordinated-inauthentic network.

channels.summary: Channel shares tools and articles on climate and environmental risks, including deforestation mapping, climate-driven species spread, infrastructure vulnerability, retracted glyphosate safety research, and open training materials for environmental data analysis.

highlights.title: Nusantara Atlas – deforestation mapping platform
highlights.details: Members recommend Nusantara Atlas as a site to visualise deforestation in Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei Darussalam, Papua New Guinea, and Colombia, useful for OSINT investigations into land-use change and environmental crime.

highlights.title: Guardian report on mosquitoes appearing in Iceland due to climate warming
highlights.details: Article notes the first detection of mosquitoes in Iceland, attributing their arrival to climate change, and serves as an example of how species distributions are shifting in response to warming.

highlights.title: Washington Post analysis of sinking U.S. dams and associated risks
highlights.details: Shared article (with an archive link) discusses how some U.S. dams are subsiding, raising safety and climate-resilience concerns about aging infrastructure.

highlights.title: Short video on reducing canteen carbon footprint via menu changes
highlights.details: A YouTube Short describes how simply swapping dishes in a canteen’s weekly menu led to a ~30% reduction in carbon footprint, illustrating behavioural nudges for climate mitigation.

highlights.title: Retraction of seminal glyphosate safety paper
highlights.details: A federated social media post is shared noting that a key paper long cited to justify glyphosate’s safety has been retracted over concerns about authorship and misrepresented contributions, which may impact regulatory debates.

highlights.title: Copernicus Marine Service Jupyter notebooks for environmental monitoring
highlights.details: Copernicus provides tutorial Jupyter notebooks as e-learning materials for marine environmental monitoring and analysis, which can help OSINT practitioners work with satellite and model data.

highlights.title: Nature article on an environmental/climate topic
highlights.details: A Nature article (d41586-025-03316-w) is shared; while the precise topic isn’t summarised in chat, it’s flagged as relevant to environment or climate-change issues being followed by members.
